Summary Heading: Nice and clean old style motor court motel.
Summary: Basic rooms, clean, slightly expensive due to its being near to Disneyland. Has cable, daily room cleaning. Drive up to the room parking. Next to a 7-11 and a McDonalds is in walking distance. Also near a shopping center with a grocery store, drug store and lots of variety eats places.
Room tip: Near the rear away from the street.

I looked for rooms at other hotels and the ones I check out did not look as; good as the Legacy Inn. The Legancy Inn was very convience for my family. The price was just right for us. Summary: The beds.were comfortable, but.could use another blanket. The bathrooms were nice but could use additional and.better quality towels. Hardwood floors were nice, but no mats for after bathroom. Nice size room, had a couch and coffee table. Location was only a 5 minute drive to.disney, but sketchy looking area and not much in.walking distance. It was decent for the price on.memoria. day weekend.

We stayed in a non-smoking room, and the floors were hardwood or some approximation thereof, but the musty odor in the room was so dense that it got onto my tongue and into the back of my throat. We cleaned off months (years?) of black dust and grit from the grill of the air-conditioner/heater.  The windows didn't open, so the only way to get fresh air into the room was to leave the door open.  The bed was so hard, someone could have been doing jumping jacks on one side and the other side wouldn't have moved.  Good location and honest cleaning staff (left my iPhone in the room and it was still there when we returned).

Our room was clean, comfortable, and very acceptable!  I was a little concerned because one review said the bed was very hard, but fortunately this was not the case at all, it was great!  I slept very well.  The staff here is very friendly and responsive.  For a fraction of the cost of all of the surrounding hotels, we had a very enjoyable stay just a few blocks from the Anaheim Convention Center, and Disneyland!  I would stay here again in a heartbeat!

We stayed here New Year's Eve because it was cheap and near Disneyland.  My partner works for an upscale hotel chain so we are used to staying at nice hotels for little or no money.  This hotel is no luxury hotel by any standards, but it served it's purpose as we just needed a safe place to stay for one night.  The hotel is conveniently located very close to the park.  It's a little too far to walk, but the drive is only about five minutes.  There is a wide selection of stores and restaurants within walking distance from the hotel.  Anything you might need is nearby.  Also, unlike the previous review, we found the neighborhood to be safe.  The room was spacious and clean for the most part.  There aren't really any views as the building is only two stories.   The hotel was busy,

When we arrived in the room it was disgusting! It smelt bad, had damaged and broken equipment. The light shade was broken, the microwave had a huge crack in the door, the fridge was filthy.
